April 24, 1957
Dr* Burton Paulu
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burt«
Here’s a real problem* Yet I’d think it would be prohibitive to do what he
proposes* The NAEB Convention and the IERT at least help bring people together*
Maybe we should offer to pay additional expenses for all committees to meet a
full day ahead of Annual Conventions and the IERT, same time Board meets.
This, though, would not leave much for any "caHed" or special committee meetings,
during the year.
The Professional Advancement Committee, alone, each year has used a large share
of available Committee funds, yet its planning is indispensable as the sort of
^policy committee * on all this.
Rather than wrestle with this alone, and before replying to Ray, I thought
I’d pass on to you in ease the Board might like to kick this problem ar ound,
review or censure hew we’ve handled in the past, or anything else. With a
Seminar to plan, I’d guess we’ve got to find funds for the Research Committee
to meet as soon as possible in the fall, for a fairly intensive session.--
This could be at Saint Louis, perhaps.
Sincerely,
Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
